page.title: 14ST. MARY'S CHURCH BUNNY
page.content: Bunny church is called{St.Mary the {Virgin}or the cathedral of the Wolds because it is the biggest church in the area. The vicar is the Reverend C. Jones who comes to our school every Wednesday. He holds a service at 0900 on Sunday in Bradmore Chapel and in Bunny Church at 1830 hrs. On the great festivals of Christmas, Easter and Ascension special services are held. One unusual service is the{Christingle for children held after Christmas and the money collected is sent to the N.S.P.C.C. There has been a church in Bunny since 1228. The church has six bells, it is unusual because it has two fonts but only the north one is used for baptisms. The church is very popular for weddings, when it is gaily decorated with flowers. Many villagers are buried in the churchyard and there is a memorial to Sir Thomas Parkyns.
